subtitle: Take three contrasting fish and different spices and make this dish into something that is very more-ish.

method.text: Put the salmon, haddock and cod into a pan. Pour in the milk, cover and poach gently for 8-10 min. Remove from the heat. Remove fish, reserving the milk.
Skin and bone the fish and flake into pieces.
In a heavy based pan, put the cardamom seeds, cumin, mustard and coriander seeds. Dry fry for 2-3 min. Remove from the hea. Crush seeds into a fine powder in a mortar with a pestle.
In a large pan, melt half the butter and saute the onion without colouring. Stir in the turmeric and rice plus the reserved milk liquor and the measured water. Season to taste.
Cook covered for 10-15 min, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, until the rice is just tender. Meanwhile, coarsely chop the hard-boiled egg.
When the rice is cooked, stir in the egg, fish, half the parsley and lemon rind and juice. Stir in the cream. Reheat gently until piping hot.
Serve in a hot serving dish. Garnish with remaining parsley.

title: Three fish kedgeree
